thread.title: Shellfish lovers bummed by crackdown on Marin oyster oasis
thread.title_full: Shellfish lovers bummed by crackdown on Marin oyster oasis - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Peter Fimrite
title: Shellfish lovers bummed by crackdown on Marin oyster oasis
text:
Photo: Paul Chinn, The Chronicle Tomales Bay Oyster Company manager Martin Seiler cradles a freshly shucked Pacific oyster in Marshall, Calif. on Friday, Oct. 2, 2015. The popular spot on the eastern shore of Tomales Bay is being to forced to close down its picnic areas by Marin County citing a concern for parking and traffic issues along Highway 1. Tomales Bay Oyster Company manager Martin Seiler cradles a freshly...
Mollusk lovers around the Bay Area are rallying to the defense of a popular oyster farm in Marin County that is being forced to halt picnicking and turn away the public after the county accused the establishment of violating its permit. The popular spot on the eastern shore of Tomales Bay is being to forced to close down its picnic areas by Marin County citing a concern for parking and traffic issues along Highway 1.
